comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: First of all thanks to @Husires for maintaining thread for last few years. It was very useful. Haven't checked this topic for some time and I surprised to see quite a lot decentralised processors. Nothing wrong with BTCPay Server, but it's always good to have more than one option. Maybe there is members who use one of these gateways? It would be interesting to hear pros and cons of it.

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Found two more that weren't part of the previous thread:Whitepay - It supports 140+ cryptocurrencies and it seems to have fiat/crypto conversions, but it's limited to users in "Ukraine, Turkey and the UAE [for now]".- Last year, they "organized a fundraiser with WhiteBit" to support Ukraine.0xprocessing - It's a "new" processor that charges a 0.4% fee. It has an autoconversion feature and it claims it doesn't ask for KYC stuff.

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: There is also: rocketfuelblockchain.com https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5440435 And confirmo although their rates suck ass: https://confirmo.net/pricing And SatSale: https://github.com/SatSale/SatSaleIf at all possible it would probably be good to mention more then just 'fees' since like with confirmo there is a fee to get the crypto and a fee to send it back out again and so on. Total cost to use perhaps?There is a lot of DYOR for people but having a bit more information here might help.Also, I made this post a while ago: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5366008Another column that lists the last known % away from the average BTC might be good. Having a 1% fee is fine but if their rates suck that bad you will loose customers.-Dave
